intro: Chrysanthemum yantaiense, commonly known as the Yantai chrysanthemum, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to China. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to yellow and orange. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has finely divided, feathery leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun, making it a popular ornamental plant in gardens. Its blooming period occurs in the autumn, adding vibrant color to landscapes during the late season.
